page.title: 05A Shopping Trip, Corby
page.content: If you go to Corby Town Centre on a Saturday there will almost certainly be an open air market in the Market Square. A market is a place where there are stalls which have items to be sold on them. In Corby market the majority of stalls sell clothes. Another of the popular stalls is the jewellery stall. Sometimes you can also see young pavement artists who chalk pictures on the paving stones. In the centre of Queen's Square in the summer there is a large fountain. In the summer the fountain is usually flowing but in the winter it is drained and left empty. Supermarkets are large stores which sell a wide variety of foods. The large supermarkets in Corby are Sainsbury's, International Food Stores, Kwik Save and Presto. There are many other shops in Corby but not many are chain stores.
